citations.narrative:
***The facility has not developed a written contingency plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation,
housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster (one which could reasonably be anticipated
and expected to be detrimental to the good health and well-being of the animals in their possession).
A written plan must be developed and maintained. The contingency plan must identify situations the facility might
experience that would trigger an emergency response such as electrical outages, faulty HVAC systems, fires, animal
escapes and natural disasters.
The plan shall outline specific tasks required to be carried out in response to the emergencies or disasters such as:
- detailed animal evacuation instructions or shelter-in-place instructions, provisions for providing backup sources of food
and water as well as sanitation, ventilation, bedding, veterinary care, etc.
- identify a chain of command and who (by name or by position title) will be responsible for fulfilling these tasks.
- Address response, recovery and training needed.
- Personnel shall be trained regarding their roles and responsibilities.
Correct by June 15, 2025.

***The exercise yard for the spider monkeys does not have a perimeter fence. The yard is a new construction that is
currently already in use. A six foot perimeter fence is required to protect the animals in the facility by restricting animals
and unauthorized persons from going through it or under it and having contact with the animals in the facility, and so that
it can function as a secondary containment system for the animals in the facility. It must be of sufficient distance from the
outside of the primary enclosure to prevent physical contact between animals inside the enclosure and animals or
persons outside the perimeter fence.
A perimeter fence shall be constructed to protect the spider monkeys from unauthorized contact and act as a secondary
containment for them.
Correct by August 15, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
